Class Ghost

java.lang.Object
ijae.xgalead00.entity.Entity
ijae.xgalead00.entity.Ghost
public class Ghost extends Entity
Represents a Ghost entity on the board. Handles movement, enraged state, and collision detection with the player.

      private final Random random

    • enraged

      Whether the ghost is in an enraged (vulnerable) state

  • Constructor Details

    • Ghost

      public Ghost(int initx, int inity, javafx.scene.image.Image[] BaseImages, javafx.scene.image.Image[] enragedFrames)
      Constructs a Ghost at the given position with normal and enraged images. Picks a random initial direction.
      Parameters:
      initx - initial x-coordinate
      inity - initial y-coordinate
      BaseImages - normal frames (facing right)
      enragedFrames - frames for enraged state

  • Method Details

    • update

      public void update(Tiles[][] tiles)
      Updates the ghost's movement each game step. Moves twice if enraged and may randomly change direction.
      Parameters:
      tiles - 2D array of board tiles

    • ChooseRandomDirection

      private void ChooseRandomDirection(Tiles[][] tiles)
      Chooses a random accessible direction for the ghost.
      Parameters:
      tiles - 2D array of board tiles

    • CollidesWith

      public boolean CollidesWith(Player player, int prevPlayerX, int prevPlayerY, int prevGhostX, int prevGhostY)
      Checks if the ghost collides with the player. Handles same-tile collisions, crossed paths, and multiple-step movement.
      Parameters:
      player - the player entity
      prevPlayerX - player's previous x-coordinate
      prevPlayerY - player's previous y-coordinate
      prevGhostX - ghost's previous x-coordinate
      prevGhostY - ghost's previous y-coordinate
      Returns:
      true if a collision occurred

    • enraged

      public void enraged()
      Puts the ghost into the enraged state. Updates its animation frames accordingly.
